revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person |name=William Gosling |birth_date=15 August 1892 |death_date=12 February 1945 |birth_place= [[Wanborough, Wiltshire]] |death_place= [[Wroughton]], Wiltshire |placeofburial=St John & St Helen's Churchyard Cemetery Extension, Wroughton |image= Victoria Cross Medal without Bar.png |caption= |nickname= |allegiance={{UK}} |serviceyears= |rank=Major |branch=[[File:Flag of the British Army.svg|23px]] [[British Army]] |commands= |unit=[[Royal Artillery]]
[[Home Guard (United Kingdom)|Home Guard]] |battles= [[World War I]]
[[World War II]] |awards= [[Victoria Cross]] |laterwork= }} Major '''William Gosling''' [[Victoria Cross|VC]] (15 August 1892 – 12 February 1945) was an [[England|English]] recipient of the [[Victoria Cross]], the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to [[United Kingdom|British]] and [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] forces. Gosling was a twenty-four years old [[sergeant]] in the 3rd Wessex Brigade, [[Royal Field Artillery]], during the [[First World War]]. On 5 April 1917 near [[Arras, France|Arras]], [[France]], a bomb was fired by the [[Stokes Mortar]] from Sergeant Gosling's battery; it had a faulty cartridge, and fell ten yards from the mortar near front-line infantry. Sergeant Gosling, after discussion with his battery and on vehement demands from the infantry, left the trench, lifted the nose of the bomb which had sunk into the ground, unscrewed the fuse and threw it on the ground where it immediately exploded. This action undoubtedly saved the lives of the whole detachment. For this action he was awarded the Victoria Cross.{{LondonGazette|issue=30130|supp=yes|startpage=5866|date=12 June 1917|accessdate=29 April 2015}} During World War II he served as a [[major]] in the [[Home Guard (United Kingdom)|Home Guard]]. He died aged 52. ==References== {{Reflist}} *[http://www.homeusers.prestel.co.uk/stewart/wiltshir.htm Location of grave and VC medal] (Wiltshire) {{DEFAULTSORT:Gosling, William}} [[Category:1892 births]] [[Category:1945 deaths]] [[Category:Royal Artillery officers]] [[Category:British Home Guard officers]] [[Category:British World War I recipients of the Victoria Cross]] [[Category:British Army personnel of World War I]] [[Category:People from Swindon (district)]] [[Category:British Army recipients of the Victoria Cross]] {{England-mil-bio-stub}}
